title: Romantic moment man proposes to his girlfriend at a trendy Melbourne 'splash room'
text:
The romantic moment a man proposes to his girlfriend while the pair are in a 'splash room' has been posted online.

In video of the cute interaction filmed at the Melbourne establishment on Sunday evening, the man and woman can be seen together wearing white overalls, hard hats, and safety goggles.

The man can be seen writing in paint on the wall 'Will you marry me?' and he then draws a box for no and a box for yes.

The Melbourne splash room is the first of its kind in the world

The woman covers her hand in paint and, after a tense second, puts a hand print on the box marked yes.

Smash rooms are a phenomenon popping up across the globe where customers can pay to go into a room in which they can demolish items including electronics.

Similarly a splash room allows customers who are given paint filled water balloons and buckets to cover the walls in paint.

'We have have been working on some exciting things but nothing more exciting than this. Our first wedding proposal in our worlds first splash room.' the caption to the video reads.

Co-owner of SmashSplash Oakleigh, Baz, told Daily Mail Australia the couple were introverted and staff had no idea of the plan until the went into the room afterwards and noticed the artwork.

'They wanted to do something low key but unique and have some pictures of it,' he said.

'They took a lot of selfies and there cameras would be better quality than our video'.
